website_summaries.verdict: Modestly priced canopy for those who want something lightweight and durable.
pros: Easy set up and take down
Lightweight in comparison to similar models
cons: Not meant for prolonged exposure to rain or strong winds

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time / no replacement trusses available for 12x12' Sierra II?
customer_reviews.text: Ours broke the very first time we used it - one of the sides collapsed on a small burst of wind. We like it otherwise, so want to buy a replacement truss (it had pushed in on top). However, the only web site we've been able to find says "no parts for Sierra II". At this point we have a new, broken awning. If we do find a place to buy a replacement part, I'll update this posting.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 2 broken within 2-3 days of use. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve purchased two of these based on reviews and I have to say I’ve been extremely disappointed. Last year we used at the beach and halfway through our trip the wind got under it and snapped one of the bars that holds up the canopy and ripped through it. I thought maybe they just didn’t put it up correctly so I ordered another this year and the same piece broke. It wasn’t even that windy this year. Frankly that’s quite expensive to get a couple of uses out of it prior to them breaking. Another family left one similar to ours up all day and overnight and it was fine. I will definitely not be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good
customer_reviews.text: Update, changed to 4 to 5.-used today at a semi windy fair, set up with two folks took me 3 mins and honestly could have done it in 5 all by myself- good tent! directions could be WAY better, had to watch youtube and try various things on my own. You can get it up with one person (once you know what you are suppose to be doing) and I'd say it turns 5 mins into 10 so not so bad. I will update this review once I use it for the fair in about a week. I did a practice run in my back yard once it arrived. Update, changed to 4 to 5.
customer_reviews.author: Lina A Douglas

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A 10x10 TENT
customer_reviews.text: SO UPSET... NEEDED THIS TENT THIS WEEKEND and IT GETS LEFT IN THE RAIN WET BOX AND OPEN IT AND BOX AND DESCRIPTION SAYS 10x10 and the blue tent we own is a true 10 x 10 and look at the tan one that we received... it would fit INSIDE THIS ONE. it is a 8 x 8 FALSE ADVERTISEMENT
customer_reviews.author: Debora

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!! except for the heavy weight...
customer_reviews.text: For stars because of the heavy weight and the way too small carrying wheels. I used it only one time so far but the experience was great! Easy to set up, stable, and you can store it with the canopy on. The only cons is the weight, it's pretty heavy, is fine when you can roll it, but once you get in the sand, forget about it... the wheels are so tiny that the sand will get stuck so you will be dragging it all the way. Other than that, well made.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: LIE! NOT 10x10. Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: Liars. The Sierra II 12x12 is most certainly NOT 10x10 feet at the canopy level as clearly CLAIMED in the description I read to decide which product to buy. It’s 9x9 feet, almost exactly. That the difference between 100 sf of shade and only 81 sf, or a 20% ripoff. Obviously they know it’s only 9x9. Why LIE? One reason I bought the EZ Up brand was a perceived image of quality and trust. That trust is gone now. Aside from that, the numerous pivots were so “sticky” that two adults almost could not get the frame expanded when setting it up. Hoping those pivots loosen up over time, but who knows? They may get worse with wear.
customer_reviews.author: gregory s buchler

customer_reviews.title: E-Z UP SR9104BL Sierra II 10 by 10-Feet Canopy,...
customer_reviews.text: We own a very old version of this style E-Z UP, and the framework has had issues. Since this was a gift, it was wonderful to see all issues with setup had been resolved. The new locking mechanisms on each leg were very easy to work with, making set up and tear down a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy canopy - built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy canopy; expect this to last much longer than the less expensive one purchased from a chain sporting goods store. Only complaint is that it cannot be "angled" (lower the legs on one side to reduce sun exposure) like the cheaper one I had before, but I was aware of that prior to purchase. The wheeled carry bag is a nice feature. Have used this for outdoor sporting events/tailgating with no issues. Easy to set up and take down with 2 people. Like that it has a high vaulted canopy, which provides more headroom for taller people.
customer_reviews.author: PreciousJewel76

customer_reviews.title: Don't use in the rain!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my dog kennel. Very easy to set up. But it can not be used in the rain. Rain water collects in the top. If you do not go out in the rain and empty the collected rain the whole frame will bend making the canopy unuseable. Happened with the first one I bought. Got another after this ones frame twisted and broke from the rain. To my misfortune the same thing happened to the second one. You can not predict how much rain there will be or be home all the time to take the cover off. Was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chichi

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy tent that can't resist strong wind
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a shade for our backyard due to the summer scorching temperature, but it ended up in our neighbor's yard by a strong wind one night. We followed the instructions to tie it down to the ground but that did not help secure it. It was fortunate that it did not hurt anyone or caused any property damage, or we could have ended up with a big liability. The set up was also not as easy as it claimed to be "one minute" as it was more involved and required a couple of people to help set up. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these for years fine had to replace it do to pin holes in the topper the frame was fine on the one I replaced but I wasn’t able to find just that to replace. My other unit after years of use a part not the frame broke but I found a used one with other issue and replaced the part I needed. If took care of and stored properly they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Best tent on the beach!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy for 2 people to put up on the beach. Takes 5 minutes or less. My in-laws had a similar tent from another brand and it wasn’t nearly as good as our EZ-UP. We used the included stakes and piled mounds of sand over bottoms of legs. Never has an issue with wind while many other tents did. Rolling case is perfect and easy to get the tent in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: GU3FAM

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Been using this tent for 6+ months in all sorts of situations. So far it's holding up nicely to downpours and moderate winds. I did upgrade to the heavy duty stake kit. Wish it had a built in way to attach guylines to the top for more support in windy conditions- I usually have to rig something up with bungees and lines around the various poles. I can easily set up and take this down solo as long as it's not too windy, and it's easy to transport as well. Big enough to cover dog crates and chairs at trials, or set up over a tent or picnic table while camping.
customer_reviews.author: anicole

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup with two people.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I LOVE this E-Z Up Canopy! It's easy to setup and take down, and provides good shade for a full day at the beach. We also use it on our deck at home when we have parties. My only complaint is that the wheels are small and may not roll easily over bumpy pavement. But that's minor. Buy this canopy. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Begostef

customer_reviews.title: setup easily, worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, setup easily, worked perfectly. It was a breezy day, that first, but our new slant leg 10 by 10 Easy Up stood firm all day, almost. Toward the end of the day, a particularly puffy puff of wind lifted the Easy Up and she took flight, for a moment. The flight, and subsequent crash landing tore the canopy and bent several of the bars. I called the company, Easy Up, to order replacement parts and was told that there was no charge as this is a first time warranty situation. The replacement parts and canopy were sent free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: cpt. stephen mann

customer_reviews.title: Solid...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for a backyard bbq and birthday party that I was gonna throw and figured it would last a few uses. I'm sitting at the beach and event though the wind is blowing hard it is strong and doing its job. I can set it up and take it down all by myself and it is compact for travel. It has been well worth the money and it's just one of those things you need and don't know until you have it. I got this maybe 6 months ago and it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Caecusscius

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We love our Ez up this summer especially! Easy to set up by yourself but it goes faster if you have at least one other person. We've been using it for our small back yard pool/home projects/grilling. This is the second one we've owned. We left the first one up during a storm and it got blown over and damaged.
customer_reviews.author: greenkarma

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold up in a light wind
customer_reviews.text: One time use, Junk! If you want something that will last in a light wind don't bother with this garbage. 3rd time I used this for harvesting in my garden, a light wind came and blew this canopy over and bent the steel tubes in 3 places. Very poor quality construction. Don't waste your time on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jieying Chen

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: We had to throw this canopy away after the first weekend of using it at the lake. A storm came though and rendered it unusable again. The reason I'm giving it such a good review, is because after seeing everyone else's canopies that were destroyed, this one was in MUCH better shape. Mine was only bent in 2 places. The others were nearly in a ball, if not gone completely.
customer_reviews.author: Bauer Computers

customer_reviews.title: so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: 1 person can set it up in about 5 minutes and take it down in the same amount of time. The roller bag tore after a few years but the frame and canopy are in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: sbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked famously in Oahu!
customer_reviews.text: I have to have sunscreen protection due to an autoimmune disorder. Every year we head to Oahu to relax for two weeks. The previous year I develop a skin and autoimmune disorder and told to stay under a protective umbrella. This worked so well. Yes, we had Hawaiian breezes but the umbrella was secured with sandbags, sturdy and did not have to worry about too much sun!
customer_reviews.author: Who am i

customer_reviews.title: Missing roller bag & stakes
customer_reviews.text: The item itself is fine, however it was delivered very late and is missing the bag with wheels that is supposed to be in it. I am attempting to contact seller now. EDIT: The stake kit was also missing from the box. Have returned and getting a replacement now, hopefully with all the parts necessary.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nhim

customer_reviews.title: Sunburn preventer
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for anyone who spends time on a NYC rooftop. The summer sun can be really brutal, and this beats the heat. It's definitely easier to have a friend help you set it up, but can definitely be done by a single person with some swearing and patience. It doesn't weight a whole lot, so I would recommend putting weights on each corner to make sure it doesn't blow away. It could really hurt someone if you don't do that, so be careful! The bottom of the fabric part is silver, and reflects light really well, so it's perfect for late night usage when the sun goes down!
customer_reviews.author: Well Put

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: We have use this for two years in a row at the farmers market at our booth, and now are on our third year. This has been durable and has held up. You do have to make sure you’re careful when it is windy. And make sure to use weights. We bought canopy weights.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canopy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent canopy. I needed a canopy for our backyard as we have two young children that love to be outside. I am able to set up and take it down by myself (although it does take a lot of walking around messing with the poles). It is very sturdy. I love the tan color of the canopy. I do take it down each day as it is not meant to be left up long term. It comes with a roller bag for easy storage and transport. There's also a pocket for the stakes. I highly recommend this canopy.
customer_reviews.author: ACE of Burke's

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and provided shade for 4 people.
customer_reviews.text: It was great! And very easy to put up. We've used it twice in the last month - for two days on Silver Beach on Lake Michigan and one week at Navarre Beach in Florida. We removed it from the case at the car and carried it to the beach as you can't roll the case on sand. My husband used a towel on his shoulder to cushion it and he said it wasn't very heavy. It was pretty breezy a couple days and we tied bags of sand to the legs. We highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: dht

customer_reviews.title: It’s a lot cooler in the shade!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I’m outside a lot and it’s Hot! It’s plenty of shade to take breaks in while I’m working in the yard. I can put it up and take it down by myself. It’s light enough to carry, but the wheels on the storage bag make it even easier to move around.
customer_reviews.author: PSH

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Indoor use only
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. One gust of wind and I had to tear it apart for trash. Cost me more in time cutting it up with tin snips and bundling it up for trash than it was worth in cost.
customer_reviews.author: meno

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: We used this on the beach and it worked like a charm. The photo shows the canopy on the shortest height. We witnessed many canopies getting bent and torn from the gusty winds and we decided to play it safe and keep it low. I am pretty confident it could have handled it.
customer_reviews.author: Kp

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty simple to use once you check out a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed sunshade for my backyard for my less than 2 yo who is obsessed with the backyard. I needed to be able to set it up and tear it down alone. This is pretty simple to use once you check out a couple videos on putting the shade up and taking it down without help.
customer_reviews.author: RooZillah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out fabulously. So much so, that I bought another one for our pickleball group. We now have a 10x20 area to get in the shade when the temps hit those high 80's to 90's. The group absolutely loves these canopies. Easy to set up, and take down. Store easy, don't take up much space in the club shed. Would highly recommend this canopy to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: By all indications, including photos, this product comes with a convenient roller bag to transport the canopy. It does not. Even the picture and description on the BOX it came in mention and show a roller bag. If the bag is important to you, do not order this product. Pretty disappointed...returned it before i even took it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hulen

customer_reviews.title: EZ up it is NOT
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a box that looked like it had been tapped up about 100 x before. The box was missing the weights, steaks and roller bag. EZ up it was NOT. no instruction came with it so it was quite the fiasco. One bar was already cracked right out of the box!. Needless to say, it's been returned and im waiting on my refund
customer_reviews.author: Debi VanAlstine

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Does not do well in windy conditions on the each. Even with the extra bought anchors for the legs. We had to lower it and tilt, score eventually taking it down on a couple windy days. With little or no wind, it’s perfect! Great amount of shade for plenty of people, like 5 or 6 fits comfortably with beach chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is not what they say it is It measures9’x9’ at the top Set it up at a farm market and wouldn’t even cover our tables Really how can you use measurements that are that far off ? Total at the bottom isn’t even 12’ Legs are angled out so much they actually look broken Not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble! Perfect Canopy!
customer_reviews.text: Sooo happy with this E-Z UP! The Hubby put it up in just a couple minutes by himself! We just got rid of our 6 year old generic brand Canopy that fell apart, so we were very pleased to see how well made this one is! Very sturdy, it was windy on the beach, never felt like it was going to blow away.
customer_reviews.author: Tex, Stef & Jackson

customer_reviews.title: they are the Cadillac of canopies and you will get years of excellent use out of them
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these 8 years ago and still use it frequently. We have used it at football games, track meets, and soccer games. We have used it in the sun, rain, and snow. We have used it for family gatherings, fundraisers, and just about anything you can imagine. If you get these on sale, they are the Cadillac of canopies and you will get years of excellent use out of them. Add a couple of shade walls and you have the perfect set up. These were purchased for a church youth group and I have no doubt we will get many years of durable service out of them.
customer_reviews.author: David Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with a bag
customer_reviews.text: This things seems to work fine except that it didn't come with the carrying bag that is was supposed to come with it and it's only an 8 x 8 canopy. I read the reviews and the square footage so I knew it was an 8 x 8 canopy so I can live with that but no bag not so much. Too bad because I was going to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great awning!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old canopy we had that took forever to put together and this one is a dream! So easy to set up. A little heavier that I thought it would be but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Hughes

customer_reviews.title: This is an 8' x 8' Canopy, Not 10' x 10'.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind when you read all the positive reviews that this canopy is 8' x 8'. It is not 10' x 10' regardless of what they call it. The legs spread out at the bottom for a footprint of 10' by 10'. The footprint isn't important; the canopy is. This canopy is 64 square feet. A canopy that is truly 10' x 10' is 100 square feet. That is an enormous difference. It's my fault for trusting the description; if I had read closely I would have seen, "Angle Leg Design with a 10'x10' footprint, 8'x8' at top." Now I have to deal with returning a 32 pound item because of the misleading name.
customer_reviews.author: KevBrklyn

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: Too big too heavy. No way I can set it up easily. The bottom legs have cracks and look like used too. Have to pay over $20 bucks for UPS pickup as it’s too heavy for me to drag it to Kohl’s. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anna T

customer_reviews.title: Product came cut
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, overall canopy. Except for 2 things - the canopy came 'cut' by something or someone (small, 4" tear in the top). Also, one of the legs doesn't snap in correctly - the little push button doesn't line up with its hole and therefore, pretty much stays cockeyed all the time. Other than that, it is good at keeping the sun and rain at bay.
customer_reviews.author: Gazilions

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This proved a good size to cover a car-camping table. A good compromise of sturdiness vs. weight/bulk, for a reasonable price. Definitely not flimsy: poles are not wobbly or bendy at all. Canopy material is pretty thick (much more than typical tent fly, for example). Upper frame is rock solid with the crossovers. Setup really easy. Two minor complaints: The canopy is not seam sealed, so in rain, leaks come through the seam, down the inner velcro. Easy to stop with a swipe of seam seal, but still a hassle. No guy lines if it gets windy. Probably easy to rig something up, but something I would expect to come with.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Well built and a good value compared to the cheaper canopies on the market
customer_reviews.text: We got this for some outdoor vendor events. Compared to the budget ones I've helped some folks set up, this canopy is pretty solidly built. The tubing and supports are a decently heavy gauge metal and the latches are nicely designed and seem likely to last. The top has held up fine so far, but it's normal tent material so it will wear eventually. The roller bag is ok, but pretty flimsy. The cheaper canopies don't come with a bag at all though so you can't complain too much about that. This is worth the extra money over the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: T. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use with any wind!
customer_reviews.text: Although relatively easy to put up, this blew over the first day we used it at the beach. We had the gaps up to let in some wind and used the stakes. Neither of these helped. Although the wind could not be helped, the legs on 2 sides bent significantly and could not be collapsed, making this useless. A disappointment as we then had to replace it with a beach umbrella bought at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: SBaltimore

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Have brought this camping twice now since purchasing in June. Has held up extremely well during 2 storms. Very easy to set up and take down; should almost be a one person job but it's definitely easier with 2 people. We really liked being able to lower it during the storms too, helped keep the picnic table underneath dry.
customer_reviews.author: mardemou

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - easy to put up AND put back in the bag
customer_reviews.text: Got the delivery within a couple of days (was supposed to be 10 days! First, color. I have no regret with the blue which is very nice (I was originally looking for white) - Shipping was fast - the canopy comes with a nice sturdy bag for storage - Putting the canopy up was SO easy, and as easy to fold and put back in the bag (do not bother removing the blue top, just fold it with the mounts!!!!! It is pretty heavy in comparison to other I have seen but still, if you have very windy day, it is always a good idea to secure it (common sense anyway!) I would definitively recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Val - Mass

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My old one broke and this was a great upgrade. New design buttons for raising/lowering are awesome and much easier on your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product as we've owned many Ez-up brand in the past however this model is broken after having for 1 year and only using 3 times. It broken on the outside arm where it folds. I would not suggest this model.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have purchased!
customer_reviews.text: So very easy to set up and take own. Great tent and the best I have ever owned. It is pretty sturdy and stands up well to wind if staked to the ground. Very easy to pack back in the bag and if you fold the cover into a rectangular shape when packing away, it is easy to store with the frame. The legs have easy release buttons, not those danged little round buttons that you have to push in. Makes a big difference. Well designed!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the beach (we did have another kind but it got mangled by the wind last year). Well this year it was even windier than last year and this held up find. I just sugest pulling off the cover if you leave it over night, it will be fine then. I don't know how anyone can go to the beach without one. Also, I will note that this one seemed to be easier to put up than the last one. Two people, 5 to 10 minutes is all it takes. You might could do it with one person, but it would be a pain. Anyways, I would recomend this to anyone who needs some shade!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Tiny holes appeared the first time it was used. It did rain quite a bit. We used it to cover a camping tent as an additional layer of protection since it was supposed to rain. It did it's job, but not much life left with the little holes.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Really high quality
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this canopy exudes quality. The case is big enough to get it back into it without a struggle. It has wheels and well placed handle straps to make it easy to load and carry. Comes with a pouch of wire tent stakes for holding the feet down. The corners where the blue part tensions over the framework is double layered at the stress point and uses velcro for quick mounting. You don't even have to get it perfectly positioned and it attaches just fine. I had mine blow away once (didn't stake it down) and it flew a good 40' in the air before crashing back to earth, no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Qing

customer_reviews.title: The capopy itself is the latest model with the easy pull ring adjusters
customer_reviews.text: The capopy itself is the latest model with the easy pull ring adjusters. Great EZ UP and great shade. Why only four stars? It was supposed to come with the carry bag and it didn't. When I contacted Amazon they said I needed to send the whole thing back. I needed to USE the canopy that weekend. When I called the manufacturer, they said I needed to work through Amazon and it was indeed supposed to come with the carry bag. SO beware - if you want the carry bag you have to send it all back......
customer_reviews.author: Reads on Planes

customer_reviews.title: Not E-Z Up!
customer_reviews.text: First, this is not as "E-Z Up" as advertised. You need to be pretty strong to get the top section to lock into place - my husband was but I was not. Second, the roller carrying bag that comes with it tore the very first time we tried loading the canopy into the bag. There is basically zero slack in the bag which makes it an extremely tight fit, so the bag tore as we tried to stuff it in there.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Good but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shelter for what it is. It is quite sturdy and fairly easy to set up and take down. It's biggest glitch however is it is way too heavy. Even though the bag it comes in has wheels, it is not enough to make it easy to transport. We took it to several different beaches. By the time you got from your car and to the beach, my wife and I where exhausted from carrying it. We stopped using it in favor of getting a much lighter canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Didge

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: I am able to set this up and take it down by myself. I’ve looked at off brand easy ups but they always seemed flimsy, so I went with the real deal and I’m glad I did. I would definitely buy this again, in fact we’re looking at purchasing a bigger one as well!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra G.

customer_reviews.title: Broken all Ready!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product already broke only after 4 uses? Need to get up with seller to see if it could be exchanged???
customer_reviews.author: GAIL MURPHY

customer_reviews.title: smaller than described but it works.
customer_reviews.text: The canopy is not 12×12 it's closer to 10×10. I exchanges it because I taught it was a error. However o got the same thing back. Maybe the size chart is based on how far apart the legs are on the ground. Even then that wouldn't make any sense because the legs can flex up to about two feet in any direction. I kept it because it's nice anyway just not as big as they claim.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Great Shade!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and take down, goes back in the bag without too much difficulty. Helps to have a partner assisting. Sturdy and provides good amount of shade.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chastang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's much easier to put up or down with two people, but can be done solo. Great value and just what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Raymer

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time we used it
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to use this and it broke the first time we put it together. Very disappointed for the price we paid, we thought it would be a lot more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Makaila

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up and good rain cover
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews I was somewhat concerned about not being able to set this up by myself or with very little help. My 6-yo helped me set this up for the 1st time in roughly 10-15 mins. Yes, much easier with another person but not impossible without. Although it doesn't advertise as a rain cover, we use it mostly for this purpose, and it works very well with PNW rain/drizzle for long periods of time. I left it up in the backyard for 2 days with heavier rain, and it did just fine. I'm quite pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TravelingMum

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, yet affordable E-Z UP
customer_reviews.text: To be truthful, I have no understanding why this E-Z UP is in some cases almost $100 cheaper than other ones, but I think it's definitely a pretty good purchase. I used this for a music festival and it held up well against the elements there, even though we just staked it into the ground (did not come with stakes). It was pretty easy to set up, but easier with more people (at least two and ideally 4, one for each corner). We did have a little bit of problem properly securing one side, but it didn't really seem to make much of a difference, it still stood up, and provided shade and shielded from rain.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good sun shade and rain cover.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because I sunburn easily. Used on our recent camping trip. Worked great to cover 8 people sitting at a picnic table eating in the rain. Next three days used it on the beach as a sun shade. Didn't use sunscreen, and didn't sunburn. Used with one E-Z sidewall. Needs two people to set up, and carry up hill, because it's heavy. Well constructed with strong materials. Wheels worked well on hard surfaces. Will be using on our next trip in August, and will update review if we have problems.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieAS

customer_reviews.title: Two people needed to set up
customer_reviews.text: So while I havent actually used this tent yet I did read the directions. Unfortunately it has the set-up and take-down with two people. So my planned practice set-up has been cancelled. I planned to use this partly for work events and I will have to find a kind person to help me. It is a bit heavy but not as bad as others. I am 5'3" and petite but can move it with a little effort. It does role easily in the case. If it isnt windy this weekend I will have an opportunity to use it, with a volunteer... Update to come...
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the beach and it held up great. Seems sturdy enough, but didn’t have much wind. Set up is user friendly, didn’t need the instructions. Ez up is probably canopy producer out there for the price
customer_reviews.author: Denis Potvin

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY It's only 9'x9'
customer_reviews.text: It's not 12' x 12' its 9'x9'. Total rip off DON'T BUY Plus it collapses with a little rain
customer_reviews.author: Albert M.

customer_reviews.title: It has easy pull tabs so it's much easier to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: Recently set up a bunch of EZ up tents for an event and this one (mine) was the easiest by far. It has easy pull tabs so it's much easier to set up and take down than the odler model that had a VERY difficult to push button that resulted it many many pinched fingers. Out of about 20 EZ ups, there were only a few tan ones. Shade was darker under blue, but I chose this color to match an umbrealla in my backyard and like it for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Griffins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and tear down. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: EZ Up is right. After breaking a few of the cheaper alternatives, I highly recommend this. The open/close labels really help too. This canopy goes up in a flash, the included metal stakes do a great job of keeping it anchored. Set up and tear down are very easy and quick. I used it 4 weekends in a row and it is holding up well. Plus it fits nicely into the rolling case.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Bought used and it’s great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item used for half the price and it is great! Easy to install, looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Corianne

customer_reviews.title: Mfg. Flawes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered for my trade show in November so didnt even open the box until my trade show. One of the 3 I had ordered was flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Snack Finder

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, nice size
customer_reviews.text: Heavy to lift when not together. But makes it sturdy when up. Relatives lasted 10 years. Several $50 ones we had didnt last long. 2 blew over my 6 ft fence into a mangled mess. Hopefully this one will not.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Great cover E-Z Up Sierra II 12'
customer_reviews.text: The cover worked great and was plenty big enough. I see people on here complain that the size isn't that big and it's not quite 12', but we found it to cover our picnic table with PLENTY of room to walk around it and still be under the shade. Folded up nicely into its bag. First time opening it, go slow, take your time, so you're not like the other knuckle heads on here who broke theirs! All in all, this thing is great. If it breaks or anything changes, I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Received it broken. Had no idea until today when we were on the beach using it our first time. We have a newborn and he obviously can’t sit in the sun. Extremely disappointed with that his very expensive investment.
customer_reviews.author: Talia Garofano

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: this is good but i cannot do it by myself. i need my husband to help me. maybe with more practice i will be able to. It does take 2 of us to put it back in the bag also.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This Pop-up (ez up) was so easy to use. We have never had one before nor have we ever put one up before. It is a great product and very easy to use. The first time setting it up is a little tricky since you need to put the cover on it as you are putting it up. My kids joined in (10 and 9) and they asked if they could do it by themselves next time because it was so easy. I will probably being be buying another one soon. They are easy to put back in the carrier with wheels too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mamas Crew of 5

customer_reviews.title: Well made, superior features.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice substantial canopy. It has several features that make it easier to use and superior to other lesser products. I could probably put it up by myself....but it's much easier with 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Frame Broke on First Use
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed by the quality of this item. I bought this after extensive research of what canopy would hold up on the beach best. We set it up for the first time on the beach and by the end of the day, in moderate wind, the wind had cracked the frame in 2 places and completely broken one part of the frame in two.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Altmaier

customer_reviews.title: Decent canopy
customer_reviews.text: Once canopy is up it is great. It is easy to set up, but does take two people. My previous canopy had stakes that were on ropes on each leg. Making staking it down more secure. The stakes go into holes on the feet of legs. This wouldn't be a problem if there was no wind. Nowhere, we had to fold up canopy when we experienced even slight winds. In addition, my previous canopy's bag had a zipper down length of bag. This bag only opened at the end & proved difficult, although possible, to slide canopy back in.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Good item- But parts missing
customer_reviews.text: Easy up is great, easy to put together, and easy to put up, I did it by myself in less than 5 minutes. Only issue I had was that mine arrived and was missing the storage bag. I still do not have the storage bag, and it is very hard to transport and store without it... It should have come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This canopy works very well for us. You have to keep in mind that the legs are at an angle and do not go straight up. The overal footprint is larger the the covered area. You also have to have 2 people to raise and lower the canopy. The bag is very handy for moving the canopy in and out of the garage as it has casters and a conveniant handle. I do not use the stakes that are included as I use this on my deck and use tie downs and eyebolts to hold it down. Have not tested it in big winds as I always take it down if it gets real windy. So far very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Bag included ???
customer_reviews.text: Was this suppose to come with the bag ? Mine did not ... I’ll update review once I have an answer. :(
customer_reviews.author: DksMrs

customer_reviews.title: I love having this for car camping and outdoor music festivals
customer_reviews.text: I love having this for car camping and outdoor music festivals. It provides shade, and a meeting place, shelter from rain and falling nuts, can be decorated, and goes up and down pretty quickly if 2-4 people work together. The carrying case wheels are small, so a wagon helps if you need to pull it far on unpaved surfaces. It can be lifted and carried short distances by an adult. Check the case size to see if it fits in your vehicle. Vendors at outdoor markets, who set up on pavement, where it can't be staked, weight the legs on windy days.
customer_reviews.author: Colhar

customer_reviews.title: The best Canopy hands down!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a BBQ party on a 90 degree day. Wonderful. This canopy is the best! It went up and down in 5 minutes. Stores great and is spacious. I won't be without an easy up, ever. Everyone at the party complimented on my easy up. I gotta hide this thing from family..
customer_reviews.author: FARCAM

customer_reviews.title: Tent
customer_reviews.text: Gift to West Oakland Branch Public Library. They are very happy for its usefulness in outdoor events.
customer_reviews.author: D1942

customer_reviews.title: No More Bags or Stakes
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with roller bag or stakes. Amazon will not send the bag & stakes. The manufacturer says they don’t make them anymore. Beware, if you buy this you will likely have to return it like I did because there is no bag. Tent looked good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent all season at my farmers market. It held up well and I anticipate several more seasons of use out of it. The bag also held up reasonably well, although it is starting to show signs of wear. It is easy to set up. The first two times probably took me 10 minutes to set up; after that it was about two minutes with one person. This was a great value for the money. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LaForge

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it no stars I would it lasted four months... one of the metal frames broke and punctured a whole three the canopy. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica S.

customer_reviews.title: Not all in the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it came with a bag on wheels....the bag isn’t in the box.....didn’t come with it even though it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: josh viewegh

customer_reviews.title: These are the best!
customer_reviews.text: Our summers get very hot, so when we go to the lake we take this. We set it up on the beach, tie the boat next to it, have our picnic table under it so everyone has an enjoyable day instead of complaining about the hot direct sun. It is so easy to put up, I even did it myself. I'm 48, female and not very strong, but I could put it up alone. I love this product and have already purchased 3. Everyone should have 1 or 2 in their garages.
customer_reviews.author: Paula SheRa

customer_reviews.title: poor quality .  frame bents eASY
customer_reviews.text: POOR QUALITY . PAST MY DEADLINE OR I WOULD RETURN. STRAIGHT LEG IS MUCH BETTER. THIS IS JUNK!e
customer_reviews.author: Danny R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It really is E-Z up. After the initial set up, you understand how it works. We find that once it is spread out, if one person stands in the center and gently pushes up on the roof braces, the other person can manuever the locking pins into place and adjust the legs much easier and faster. We had read the other reviews before purchasing it and they were very helpful. Taking it down is just as easy. It was a very good investment and the price was right. We checked out other web sites for prices, but Amazon beat everyone. Thank you Steve
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: It's really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Mostly I bought the canopy for my daughter in law. We live in Florida and the sun can be brutal during my granddaughters outside sports activities. She had seen other parents had the E-Z UP and mentioned that brand. The parents line them up, then sit in the shade. Soccer has ended now and competitive swimming is beginning. During the meets, no one is allowed in the pool but the competitors. Again, that sun beating down is seriously here. We all appreciate the canopy. It's really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: flcooksey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Canopy
customer_reviews.text: I used this canopy several times on a beach vacation and it performed flawlessly. It was simple to put up and take down even in the wind. It was very sturdy and provided great shade for us during our entire trip. It was not too heavy and could be carried by one person to and from the beach. Each time we put it up or took it down there were two people doing the job and it can be raised and lowered in just a few minutes. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice canopy/shelter. Sets up in about 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Nice canopy/shelter. Sets up in about 15 minutes, with another person, should set up in 5 minutes. The stake holes on the legs point towards the inside of the canopy. They should point to the outside of the canopy for better securing with stakes. The stakes are very flimsy, 12" nails are better but they split the plastic stake holes.
customer_reviews.author: 2A Supporter

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product does not come with a bag which makes it a ridiculous hassle to carry around and store. It's like selling a table without the legs. Absurd. Don't be fooled by the picture that clearly shows a rolling bag. I am never buying from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This canopy is sturdy and easy to set up. I attend a lot of festivals as a vendor, and this really does the job well. The initial setup takes a little longer because you have to put the canopy on for the first time. After that though, it takes less time because the canopy stays on. This literally sets up and tears down in minutes. It's quality built and I can tell it will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: LDG

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a 10x10 & there were a number of holes in the canopy cover! Very disappointed & I don’t have a box to send it back in!! *only gets one star because I can’t leave a review w/o it)
customer_reviews.author: April Darnell

customer_reviews.title: I am happy that when we got it we set it up ...
customer_reviews.text: This really is an E-Z up canopy! We used it with the E-Z shade sidewalls for a camping trip and it really stood up to some gusty lake winds, and rain. I am happy that when we got it we set it up right away and "practiced" putting it up and taking it down a few times in order to be able to do it quickly when needed. The roller case is super convenient too.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

product_meta.title: E-Z UP SR9104BL Sierra II 10 by 10-Feet Canopy, Blue, Royal Blue, 10' x 10'
product_meta.description:
Color:Royal Blue| Size:10' x 10'| Style:Canopy

E-Z UP SIERRA II INSTANT SHELTER. GET SHADE ANYWHERE.
Now stronger and even easier to open, the Sierra II Instant Shelter is a high-quality shelter designed for years of recreational use. Upgraded Cool Grey components enhance the performance, while adding a touch of style. The classic slant-leg design adds stability and the UV resistant top offers better protection from the sun. The lightweight E-Z UP canopy is the ideal shade solution for sporting events, backyards, picnics, parties, relaxing on the beach, and so much more. 

THE E-Z UP DIFFERENCE
As the industry leader E-Z UP has worked tirelessly to perfect their unique designs, taking both new technology and customer feedback into account, and are proud to make their award winning products better and better. E-Z UP Products are loaded with completely new innovations and a range of improved features that are designed to enchance your E-Z UP brand product experience even further. For nearly 30 years, E-Z UP has produced high quality shelters and are confident there is a model and price to fit any of your needs. 

From concept, to development, to finished product, E-Z UP meticulously designs, engineers and tests each individual element of their patented systems. E-Z UP employs a broad range of sophisticated design and manufacturing processes which come together to make the E-Z UP family of products reliable and hassle free, every time. 

SIERRA II INSTANT SHELTER FEATURES:
 * Clear Span Cathedral Ceiling
 * Toggle Leg Adjustment: Adjustable legs with 2 height options
 * E-Z Glide Truss Washers: Increased Stability
 * Auto Slider Pull-Pin: Improved Auto Slider Pull-Pin for quick lock release.
 * High-Strength End Caps:Heavy-duty end caps for greater durability
 * Includes convenient roller bag & stakes
 * 2 Year Warranty

WHAT'S INCLUDED?
 * Fabric Top
 * Folding Powder-Coated Steel Frame
 * Convenient Roller Bag
 * Spike Kit
 * 2 Year Warranty
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT & PORTABLE - Weighing only 31 pounds this lightweight canopy is one of our lightest and most portable models.

ONE MINUTE SETUP - Takes only a minute to set up. Folding steel frame with no loose parts. No tools required. Setup and breakdown is quick and easy with the push button toggle leg adjustments and the oversize easy grab pull pins at the top corners.
ANGLE LEG DESIGN - 64 sqft of shade. Stable base with an extra wide 10'x10' footprint and 8'x8' at top. Weight:31 lbs.
TAKE ANYWHERE - This canopy is ready for anything and anywhere. Take this to the beach one day and a family BBQ the next. This lightweight canopy is easy to transport from place to place.
FIRE RESISTANT / 99% UV Protection – The canopy meets CPAI-84 and NFPA-701 fire resistant requirements as well as offers 99% UV protection.
2 HEIGHT SETTINGS - Two different height settings allow you to pick the height that best suits your needs.

WATER RESISTANT - The E-Z UP Instant Shelter is water resistant and will protect you from a light rain but should not be used in prolonged rainy conditions. Rain and wind can cause damage to the E-Z UP Instant Shelter. Recommended: Stake or weigh down your shelter.
The E-Z UP Sierra II instant portable canopy is economical, lightweight, and convenient
Angle Leg Design with a 10'x10' footprint, 8'x8' at top. Weight:31 lbs.
Takes only a minute to set up due to its folding steel frame having no loose parts to put together and needs no ropes or tools for assembly
CPAI-84 fire resistant fabric top blocks 99 percent of UV rays
E-Z UP Sierra II has a durable white-powder-coated steel, rust-resistant frame

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,210 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
